column19: Avery Architectural & Fine Arts Library, Columbia University
column25: A tunnel book, or peep show, that is part of an ongoing series of artists' books referencing old travel guidebooks and maps. This view of Paris is from the top floor of the Institut de Monde Arabe. The images were painted on pages from Les Guides Bleus published in 1952.
column95: Images were painted directly on guidebook pages, then offset printed and accordian bound on sides by hand. Number 397 from an edition of 500. Issued in an envelope, with a hand-painted "stamp" of Paris pasted onto the upper right corner.
column104: 1 v. ([6)] leaves) : col. ill. ; 13 x 18 cm + 1 notebook ([18] p. : ill. ; 11 cm)

column19: Avery Architectural & Fine Arts Library, Columbia University
column25: "This book was built by ten women paper architects. Their tools were knives and bone folders, and four Vandercook printing presses. They blended three typefaces ...: Garamond, Ehrhardt, and Fournier."--Colophon. In a clear acrylic slipcase as issued. Edition limited to 109 copies, signed by the artists. Paper architects: Jenny Karin Morrill; Ali Standish; Alycia Lang; Jennifer Wineke; Mandesha Marcus; Catherine Wang; Kathryn Hunt; Ilse Wogau; Jennifer Cohen, Winnie Ding.
column95: Book consists of double sided, accordion-folded sections sewn together in pairs; illustrated with pop-ups and papercuts and is letterpress printed.
